intro: Saurauia garcia-barrigae, commonly known as the Garcia-Barriga's saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the cloud forests of Ecuador and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, adapting to the humid, shaded conditions of its native habitat. Its botanical features include woody stems and a compact growth form, which help it thrive in the competitive environment of the rainforest floor. Saurauia garcia-barrigae is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its ecosystem.
